text: Elections to Chorley Borough Council were held on 6 May 2010. One third of the council was up for election and the Conservative party held overall control. After the election, the composition of the council was: {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Party!!Seats |- |style="background-color: " | |Conservative ||align=center| 27 |- |style="background-color: " | |Labour ||align=center|15 |- |style="background-color: " | |Independent ||align=center| 2 |- |style="background-color: " | |Liberal Democrat ||align=center| 3 |} ==Election result== ==Results Map== {| | 2010 results | Previous 2006 results |} ==Ward results== ===Adlington and Anderton ward=== ===Astley and Buckshaw ward=== ===Chisnall ward=== ===Chorley East ward=== ===Chorley North East ward=== ===Chorley North West ward=== ===Chorley South East ward=== ===Chorley South West ward=== ===Clayton le Woods and Whittle le Woods ward=== ===Clayton le Woods North ward=== ===Clayton le Woods West and Cuerden ward=== ===Coppull ward=== ===Eccleston and Mawdesley ward=== ===Euxton North ward=== ===Euxton South ward=== ===Pennine ward=== ===Wheelton and Withnell ward=== ==References== * Candidates list from Chorley Borough Council 2010 Category:2010 English local elections Category:May 2010 events in the United Kingdom Category:2010s in Lancashire
title: 2010 Chorley Borough Council election
